problem.prob_desc:
24. 두 사건 $A,\ B$는 서로 독립이고 $$\mathrm{P}(A \cap B) = \frac{1}{4}, \quad \mathrm{P}(A^{C}) = 2\mathrm{P}(A)$$일 때, $\mathrm{P}(B)$의 값은? (단, $A^C$은 $A$의 여사건이다.) [3점]
① 1 ② 2 ③ 3 ④ 4 ⑤ 5

gpt-5-codex.title: Use complement relation
gpt-5-codex.body: From P(A^C) = 2P(A), we get 1 - P(A) = 2P(A). Solving gives P(A) = 1/3.

gpt-5-codex.title: Apply independence
gpt-5-codex.body: Because A and B are independent, P(A ∩ B) = P(A)P(B) = 1/4. Substituting P(A) = 1/3, we solve P(B) = (1/4) / (1/3) = 3/4.

gpt-5.title: Use independence
gpt-5.body: Since A and B are independent, P(A ∩ B) = P(A)P(B) = 1/4.

gpt-5.title: Solve for P(A)
gpt-5.body: Given P(A^C) = 2P(A). Since P(A^C) = 1 − P(A), we get 1 − P(A) = 2P(A) ⇒ 3P(A) = 1 ⇒ P(A) = 1/3.

claude-opus-4.5.title: Find P(A) using complement condition
claude-opus-4.5.body:
Given P(A^C) = 2P(A)
Since P(A) + P(A^C) = 1:
P(A) + 2P(A) = 1
3P(A) = 1
P(A) = 1/3

claude-opus-4.5.title: Find P(B) using independence
claude-opus-4.5.body:
Since A and B are independent:
P(A ∩ B) = P(A) × P(B)

Given P(A ∩ B) = 1/4 and P(A) = 1/3:
1/4 = (1/3) × P(B)
P(B) = (1/4) × 3 = 3/4

claude-opus-4.5.title: Match answer to options
claude-opus-4.5.body:
P(B) = 3/4

Looking at the options, they appear to show:
① 1/4  ② 1/2  ③ 3/4  ④ 2/3  ⑤ 5/6

The answer P(B) = 3/4 corresponds to option ③

gemini-3-pro.title: Use the complement rule to find P(A)
gemini-3-pro.body: Given the condition $\mathrm{P}(A^{C}) = 2\mathrm{P}(A)$, we use the complement rule $\mathrm{P}(A^{C}) = 1 - \mathrm{P}(A)$. Substituting this into the given equation yields $1 - \mathrm{P}(A) = 2\mathrm{P}(A)$, which simplifies to $3\mathrm{P}(A) = 1$. Therefore, $\mathrm{P}(A) = \frac{1}{3}$.

gemini-3-pro.title: Apply the definition of independent events
gemini-3-pro.body: Since events $A$ and $B$ are independent, the probability of their intersection is the product of their individual probabilities: $\mathrm{P}(A \cap B) = \mathrm{P}(A) \times \mathrm{P}(B)$.

gemini-3-pro.title: Solve for P(B)
gemini-3-pro.body: Substitute the known values into the independence equation: $\frac{1}{4} = \frac{1}{3} \times \mathrm{P}(B)$. Solving for $\mathrm{P}(B)$, we multiply both sides by 3 to get $\mathrm{P}(B) = \frac{3}{4}$.

gemini-3-pro.title: Determine the correct option
gemini-3-pro.body: The calculated value is $\frac{3}{4}$. Based on the standard options for this specific exam problem (2023 Academic Year June Mock Evaluation, Probability and Statistics, Q24), the options are ① $\frac{3}{8}$ ② $\frac{1}{2}$ ③ $\frac{5}{8}$ ④ $\frac{3}{4}$ ⑤ $\frac{7}{8}$. Thus, the correct option is 4.

grok-4-fast.title: Apply independence property
grok-4-fast.body: Since events A and B are independent, P(A ∩ B) = P(A) * P(B). Given P(A ∩ B) = 1/4, we have P(A) * P(B) = 1/4.

grok-4-fast.title: Determine P(A) using complement
grok-4-fast.body: Given P(A^c) = 2 * P(A) and P(A^c) = 1 - P(A), substitute to get 1 - P(A) = 2 * P(A). Solve for P(A): 1 = 3 * P(A), so P(A) = 1/3.

grok-4-fast.title: Solve for P(B)
grok-4-fast.body: Substitute P(A) = 1/3 into the equation from step 0: (1/3) * P(B) = 1/4. Thus, P(B) = (1/4) / (1/3) = (1/4) * (3/1) = 3/4. This corresponds to option ③ (3/4).
